summary.para: Allows the common dialog box to filter objects that the view displays.

param.name: ppshv
param.para: A pointer to the view's interface.

param.name: pidl
param.para: A PIDL, relative to the folder, that identifies the object.

returns.para: The browser should return S_OK to include the object in the view, or S_FALSE to hide it.

remarks.para: This method is called by the implementation when hosted in file dialog boxes. The enumerator calls this method to let the common dialog box filter out objects that should not be displayed. Typically, the file dialog boxes will get the display text of the item, and filter by the extension.
Call this method before returning an object in the Shell folder's IDLIST enumerator.

When dealing with data sources that have many items, such as libraries and searches, the callback to this method results in poor performance. To avoid that situation, implement and return CDB2GVF_NOINCLUDEITEM. Doing so enables the view to skip calling ICommDlgBrowser.IncludeObject, thereby improving performance.

summary.para: Called when a user double-clicks in the view or presses the ENTER key.

param.name: ppshv
param.para: A pointer to the view's interface.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The browser should return S_OK if it has processed the action or S_FALSE to let the view perform the default action.
This method allows the default command to be handled by the common dialog box instead of the view.

summary.para: Called after a state, identified by the uChange parameter, has changed in the interface.

param.name: ppshv
param.para: A pointer to the view's interface.

param.name: uChange
param.para: Change in the selection state. This parameter can be one of the following values.
The focus has been set to the view.
The view has lost the focus.
An item has been checked or unchecked.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method is used to let the common file dialog boxes track the state of the view and change its user interface as needed.
When items in the view are selected, or when the view loses the focus, it needs to call this method to notify the common dialog that either the view state or selection state is changing.

summary.para: Exposed by the common file dialog boxes to be used when they host a Shell browser. If supported, ICommDlgBrowser exposes methods that allow a Shell view to handle several cases that require different behavior in a dialog box than in a normal Shell view. You obtain an ICommDlgBrowser interface pointer by calling on the object.

remarks.para: Note In Windows XP and earlier, this interface was defined in Shlobj.h.
This interface is implemented only by the common file dialog boxes.
Use ICommDlgBrowser when you need to provide special behavior while hosted inside the common dialog boxes.
